revisions.rev:
'''Bengt Andersson''' (born March 6, 1966 in Mora, Sweden) is a [[Sweden|Swedish]] rifle shooter. He was a [[300 metre rifle|300 m rifle]] specialist during most of the 1980-90s and won an individual gold medal in [[300 metre rifle prone]] and was a part of the winning team at the 1998 [[ISSF World Shooting Championships]] in [[Zaragoza]], [[Spain]]. {|class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" !colspan=3|World Championship results |- !Event !1998 |- |- |align=left|[[300 metre rifle prone]] Individual |style="background: #ccffcc"|{{Gold1}}
598 |} ==External links== * [http://www.issf-sports.org/shooters/shooter.ashx?personissfid=SHSWEM0603196601 Andersson's profile at ISSF NEWS] {{Sportshooting-bio-stub}} {{Persondata | NAME = Andersson, Bengt | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = March 6, 1966 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Mora | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Andersson, Bengt}} [[Category:1966 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Sport shooters]] [[Category:Swedish sport shooters]] [[Category:Swedish sport shooting biography stubs]] [[cs:Bengt Andersson]] [[de:Bengt Andersson]] [[nl:Bengt Andersson]] [[no:Bengt Andersson]] [[sv:Bengt Andersson]]
